spike.translation[0].definitions[0].defi: something long and thin with a sharp point, especially a pointed piece of metal
spike.translation[0].definitions[1].defi: a sudden large increase in the number or rate of something
spike.translation[1].definitions[0].defi: to secretly add strong alcohol or a drug to someoneâ€™s drink or food
spike.translation[1].definitions[0].exam: The orange juice had been spiked with gin.
spike.translation[1].definitions[1].defi: if the number or rate of something spikes, it increases quickly and by a large amount
spike.translation[1].definitions[1].exam: New telephone orders have spiked in the last two years.
spike.translation[1].definitions[2].defi: to push a sharp tool or object into something
spike.translation[1].definitions[3].defi: to prevent someone from saying something or printing something in a newspaper
spike.translation[1].definitions[3].exam: a clumsy attempt to spike rumours of a cabinet split
spike.translation[1].definitions[4].defi: to powerfully throw an American football down on the ground to celebrate a touchdown
spike.translation[1].definitions[5].defi: to powerfully hit a volleyball down over the net
